intro: Hoslundia oppositifolia, commonly known as the oppositeleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of elliptical, opposite leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds, a feature common among the Asteraceae family. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Hoslundia oppositifolia is often found in grasslands and along coastal areas, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
